messages.text:
I don't understand what's going on in my Documenter build, almost every example block errors with `MethodError: no method matching iterate(::Nothing)`<https://gitlab.com/JuliaGPU/AbstractPlotting-jl/-/jobs/912130931>

The return objects in these blocks are all new kinds of figure objects that I'm introducing in that PR, and granted a lot of them should error, but at least a couple shouldn't. I have only overloaded the `display` method for them, but I don't even understand where iteration is going on? I tested a very simple block and that worked fine for me locally..

Is Documenter doing something with my return values that they don't allow?

attachments.title: docs (#912130931) · Jobs · JuliaGPU / AbstractPlotting-jl
attachments.text: An abstract interface for plotting libraries, part of the Makie ecosystem.

method for them, but I don't even understand where iteration is going on? I tested a very simple block and that worked fine for me locally..

Is Documenter doing something with my return values that they don't allow?

messages.text: Hello.  I've suggested a pull request to Base.Docs to improve `HTML` so that it can nest property.  I don't see any detrimental side-effect of this change (the existing behavior is pretty much unusable so I can't imagine anyone relying upon it).  <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/38889>

messages.text:
In Documenter.jl, how do I use `@docs` for functions that are not in my main module file? For example, I have:
```./src/MyPackage.jl
./src/auxiliary_functions.jl```
And I'd like to document my `auxiliary_functions.jl`

elements.text: In Documenter.jl, how do I use
@docs
for functions that are not in my main module file? For example, I have:

./src/MyPackage.jl
./src/auxiliary_functions.jl
And I'd like to document my
auxiliary_functions.jl

Per `DocumenterTools.jl`, shouldn't
```julia> DocumenterTools.genkeys(user="JuliaDocs", repo="git@github.com:JuliaDocs/DocumenterTools.jl.git")
[ Info: add the public key below to <https://github.com/JuliaDocs/git@github.com:JuliaDocs/DocumenterTools.jl.git/settings/keys> with read/write access:```
actually `@info`
```julia> DocumenterTools.genkeys(user="JuliaDocs", repo="git@github.com:JuliaDocs/DocumenterTools.jl.git")
[ Info: add the public key below to <https://github.com/JuliaDocs/DocumenterTools.jl/settings/keys> with read/write access:```
? I think there's a similar URL pattern in the secret.

messages.text:
Can’t I add a docstring ref, e.g.,
```@docs
GeophysicalFlows.TwoDNavierStokes.energy_work```
twice in the documentation? I want to have this in the module docs but I want to also point to this in some other part of the docs.

I get:
```┌ Warning: duplicate docs found for 'GeophysicalFlows.TwoDNavierStokes.energy_work' in `@docs` block in src/stochastic_forcing.md:510-512
│ ``
@docs
│ GeophysicalFlows.TwoDNavierStokes.energy_work
│``
└ @ Documenter.Expanders ~/.julia/packages/Documenter/FuXcO/src/Expanders.jl:313```
